result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaden Martin Raatz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Oren Jakobson

3:52 PM Defendant Kaden Martin Raatz in court, in custody.   Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Kaden Martin Raatz.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are:  22CF126, 22CF186, 22CF280, 22CM74 and 22CM77.

Court calls the cases.
ADA Cassidy states the appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CF126:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In 

22CF186:
Count 1 - Guilty 
Count 2 - Guilty
Count 3 - Guilty 
Count 4 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 5 - Guilty

22CF280:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 3 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 4 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 5 - Guilty 
Count 6 - Guilty 

22CM74:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In 

22CM77:
Count 1 - Guilty 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 in 22CM77:  Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) 943.50(1m)(b) & (4a), guilty of Count 1 in 22CF186: Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer 346.04(3), guilty of Count 2 in 22CF186:  Bail Jumping - Felony 946.49(1)(b), guilty of Count 3 in 22CF186:   Bail Jumping - Felony 946.49(1)(b), guilty of Count 5 in 22CF186:  Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) 943.50(1m)(b) & (4a), guilty of Count 5 in 22CF280:  Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor  946.49(1)(a) and guilty of Count 6 in 22CF280:  Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor  946.49(1)(a) 
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
**Dismissed and Read In:
22CM74:   Count 1
22CF126:  Count 1
22CF186:  Count 4
22CF280:  Count 1, 2, 3 & 4 

ADA Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Court asks if M.M. is in the courtroom - she does appear at today's hearing.
M.M. makes a statement to the Court with regards to the $500 cash bond she posted and is no longer asking that it be returned to her.
4:33 p.m.  Atty Jakobson makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Court will allow Atty Jakobson to preserve what he was putting on the record with regards to expungement.
Court will hold open the issue on expungement; Court will not rule on this today.
Atty Jakobson to put this in writing and file with the Court; State will be allowed to respond.
Atty Jakobson's client will not be arguing the restitution that is being requested.
4:43 p.m.  Court questions the defendant.
Defendant makes a brief statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
22CM77:
Count 1 -
Sentence Withheld 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 2 Years -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with the conditions of probation in Count 1 of 22CF186
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample 

22CF186:
Count 1 -
Sentence Withheld 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 5 Years -
**Conditions of Probation:
Conditional Jail of 170 Days in the Portage County Jail
Jail Credit of 167 Days 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not knowingly associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Not be on the premises of the trailer park as stated on the record 
No contact with Fleet Farm 
No contact with Dylan Worden or Haley Erickson 
Participate in any treatment or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time. 
Pay restitution in the amount of $289.99 in 22CM77 to Fleet Farm - to be paid first from the cash bond 
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample

Defendant Kaden Martin Raatz in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Kaden Martin Raatz.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are: 22CF-126, 22CF-186, 22CF-280, 22CM-74, 22CM-77.

11:44 AM Court calls cases. 
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

This was the date and time set for a plea and sentencing. 
Parties have engaged in discussion.
Atty Jakobson addresses the Court as to legal opinion given to his client from another attorney as to pleas/expungements in other counties.
Defendant would be entitled to appeal the conviction in Adams County.  
Defense requests a date next week to continue.
Court questions parties regarding these cases. 
Discussions continue.

Court has time this afternoon to continue. Does not work for Defense. 

State is in compliance with victim notification statutes.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

10:19 AM Defendant Kaden Martin Raatz in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Kaden Martin Raatz.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Cassidy calls the case and states the appearances. 

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY pleas entered.

Atty Jakobson anticipates coming to an agreement. 
Parties are to have a pre-trial this morning. 
Atty Cassidy clarifies filing pre-trial sheets.
Court responds.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Filed by Prosecutor.
Exhibit #P1 Copy of Criminal Complaint

3:23 PM Defendant Kaden Martin Raatz in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Kaden Martin Raatz.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler appears on behalf of Attorney Kelly A Cassidy for the State of Wisconsin. 

3:24 p.m.  Deputy Wachowiak is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Mutchler.
3:26 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.

BY THE COURT: 
Record will reflect that the witness has identified the defendant.

ADA Mutcher would ask that the Court take judicial notice of 22CF186.
Court reviews 22CF186.
Court questions ADA Mutchler if he is asking the court to take judicial notice of document #14 in 22CF186 and ADA Mutchler is.

BY THE COURT: 
Court takes judicial notice of the document referenced above.

3:30 p.m  Exhibit #P1, copy of criminal complaint, is marked for ADA Mutchler and referenced.
ADA Mutcher requests that the witness review the "probable cause" section.
Court asks that ADA Mutchler clarify the "probable cause" for the witness.
ADA Mutchler moves on with additional questions.
3:32 p.m.  ADA requests that exhibit #P1 be moved into evidence, subject to cross examination.  No objection by Atty Jakobson. Received by the Court.
Witness is excused.
Atty Jakobson has no examination.
Atty Jakobson makes his final argument and would ask that the case be dismissed.
3:34 p.m.  ADA Mutchler gives his final argument.
3:35 p.m  Atty Jakobson responds to the statements of ADA Mutchler.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Bond is continued
Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
